intro: Calyptranthes insularis, commonly known as the island calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments on mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
